skill.name: opentargets-database
skill.description: Query Open Targets Platform for target-disease associations, drug target discovery, tractability/safety data, genetics/omics evidence, known drugs, for therapeutic target identification.
skill.summary: Query Open Targets Platform for target-disease associations, drug target discovery, tractability/saf...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or file exfiltration patterns found. Network use is limited to the documented Open Targets GraphQL endpoint.

content.user_title: Explore Open Targets disease target evidence
content.value_statement: You need reliable target and disease evidence for drug discovery. This skill queries Open Targets to deliver curated associations, drugs, and safety data.
actual_capabilities: Search targets, diseases, and drugs by name or identifier
Fetch detailed target annotations with tractability and safety data
Retrieve disease details with associated targets
Pull target-disease evidence with data type filters
List known drugs for a disease with phases and mechanisms
Get all disease associations for a target with score filtering
limitations: Uses the Open Targets public API and depends on its availability
Association scores are relative rankings, not clinical confidence
Best for exploratory queries, not bulk analytics
Requires domain knowledge to interpret evidence

use_cases.title: Prioritize targets for a disease
use_cases.description: Identify high scoring targets with supporting evidence types for a selected disease area.

use_cases.title: Review known drugs and phases
use_cases.description: List drugs for a disease and inspect trial phase and mechanism of action.

use_cases.title: Assess target safety signals
use_cases.description: Fetch safety liabilities and genetic constraint for a target before validation.

prompt_templates.title: Find disease targets
prompt_templates.scenario: You only know a disease name
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for the disease Alzheimer and list the top associated targets with their scores.

prompt_templates.title: Review target profile
prompt_templates.prompt: Search BRCA1, then fetch target info including tractability and safety liabilities.

prompt_templates.title: Check disease evidence
prompt_templates.scenario: You have target and disease IDs
prompt_templates.prompt: Get genetic association evidence for ENSG00000157764 and EFO_0000249.

prompt_templates.title: Survey disease drugs
prompt_templates.prompt: List known drugs for EFO_0000249 and summarize phase and mechanism of action.

output_examples.input: Find top targets for Alzheimer disease and list evidence scores.
output: Top targets with Ensembl IDs and overall association scores
Evidence type breakdown for each target
Short notes on strongest genetic or drug evidence

best_practices: Start with search to confirm correct target or disease IDs
Request only needed fields to keep responses small
Interpret scores with evidence type context
anti_patterns: Using association scores as clinical success probabilities
Running bulk analyses through the GraphQL endpoint
Ignoring safety liabilities and constraint data

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: It works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code with Python and internet access.

faq.question: Are there limits on query volume?
faq.answer: Yes. The API is for exploratory queries; use downloads or BigQuery for bulk work.

faq.question: Can I integrate custom GraphQL queries?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the execute_query helper to send custom GraphQL queries.

faq.question: Does the skill access my files or credentials?
faq.answer: No. It only sends queries to the Open Targets public API endpoint.

faq.question: What should I do if a query fails?
faq.answer: Check the query variables and inspect returned GraphQL errors for details.

faq.question: How does it compare to using the web interface?
faq.answer: This skill provides programmatic access for automated workflows and reproducible results.
